title: How to Make Cheesecake Brownies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
steps.description: Prepare the baking pan; either grease it or line with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Place the butter into a heavy-based saucepan.
steps.description: Melt it over low heat.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Add the sugar, vanilla extract and eggs. Beat to blend well.

steps.headline: Add the flour, cocoa and salt to a separate mixing bowl.
Combine the two mixtures.
steps.description: Add the dry mixture to the wet one. Mix well.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Mix together the cream cheese and second lot of sugar.
Add the egg.
steps.description: Beat in until creamy and light.

steps.headline: Drizzle over the batter already in the pan.
steps.description: Swirl the topping using the edge of a knife or a spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the brownies for 50 to 60 minutes.
Remove when baked.
steps.description: Allow to cool in the pan, then cut into brownie squares.

steps.headline: Serve or store.
steps.description: If storing, keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Prepare a 9-inch square baking pan.
steps.description: Line with parchment paper or grease.

steps.headline: Place the chocolate and butter into a double boiler.
steps.description: Melt over low heat. Stir constantly.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.
Cream the rest of the butter with the cream cheese.
steps.description: Cream until soft, then gradually stir in the quarter cup of sugar. Cream until light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add 1 egg, 1 tablespoon flour and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
steps.description: Set aside.

steps.headline: Beat the other 2 eggs to thicken them.
steps.description: Add the 3/4 cup of sugar left into the eggs and beat to thicken.

steps.headline: Add the baking powder, salt and remaining 1/2 cup of flour.
steps.description: Mix in.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate mixture, nuts and almond extract.
steps.description: Add another teaspoon of vanilla. Stir together.

steps.headline: Pour the chocolate batter into a cup and set this single cup aside.
steps.description: Pour the rest of the chocolate batter into the prepared baking pan.

steps.headline: Pour the cheese mixture over the chocolate batter.
Top with the remaining chocolate batter from the reserved cupful.
steps.description: Use a spatula to make swirls across the top.

steps.headline: Bake the brownies.
steps.description: Place in an oven at 350ºF/180ºC. Bake for about 35 to 40 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove when baked.
steps.description: Allow to cool in the pan.

steps.headline: Cut into brownie squares.
steps.description: Serve or store. Store in an airtight container, in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325ºF/170ºC.
steps.description: Spray (using non-stick oil) or line (with parchment paper) the baking pan.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate chips and butter to a medium, heavy-based saucepan.
steps.description: Heat gently to melt.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat and let cool.
Add the eggs, sugar and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Beat until fluffy and light.

steps.headline: Add the melted chocolate mixture.
steps.description: Stir to combine.

steps.headline: Add the flour and salt.
steps.description: Mix through.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the base of the baking pan.
Place the peanut butter, cream cheese and second lot of vanilla extract into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Mix to combine.

steps.headline: Add the sugar and beat until light and fluffy.
steps.description: Add the eggs, one at a time.

steps.headline: Pour the cream in and add the flour.
steps.description: Mix to combine.

steps.headline: Pour 1/3 cup of the topping into a separate bowl.
steps.description: Set aside.

steps.headline: Pour the rest of the topping over the batter layer already in the pan.
Melt the remaining chocolate chips.
steps.description: Place them in the microwave and melt in 10-second bursts until melted, then stir until smooth. Alternatively, melt in a double boiler.

steps.headline: Pour the melted chocolate into the reserved 1/3 cup of topping mixture.
steps.description: Drop in spoonfuls over the already added batter and topping, then swirl it with either a knife or a spatula.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownie comes out clean.

steps.headline: Allow to cool in the pan.
steps.description: If wished, chill in the refrigerator to set slightly.

steps.headline: Cut into brownie squares.
steps.description: Serve or store. If storing, keep in the refrigerator in a covered container.

text: Cheesecake Brownies Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Prepare the baking pan; either grease it or line with parchment paper. Place the butter into a heavy-based saucepan. Melt it over low heat. Remove from the heat. Add the sugar, vanilla extract and eggs. Beat to blend well. Add the flour, cocoa and salt to a separate mixing bowl.  Combine the two mixtures. Add the dry mixture to the wet one. Mix well. Pour the batter into the prepared pan.  Mix together the cream cheese and second lot of sugar.  Add the egg. Beat in until creamy and light. Drizzle over the batter already in the pan. Swirl the topping using the edge of a knife or a spatula. Bake the brownies for 50 to 60 minutes.  Remove when baked. Allow to cool in the pan, then cut into brownie squares. Serve or store. If storing, keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator. German Chocolate Cheesecake Brownies Prepare a 9-inch square baking pan. Line with parchment paper or grease. Place the chocolate and butter into a double boiler. Melt over low heat. Stir constantly. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.  Cream the rest of the butter with the cream cheese. Cream until soft, then gradually stir in the quarter cup of sugar. Cream until light and fluffy. Add 1 egg, 1 tablespoon flour and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Set aside. Beat the other 2 eggs to thicken them. Add the 3/4 cup of sugar left into the eggs and beat to thicken. Add the baking powder, salt and remaining 1/2 cup of flour. Mix in. Add the chocolate mixture, nuts and almond extract. Add another teaspoon of vanilla. Stir together. Pour the chocolate batter into a cup and set this single cup aside. Pour the rest of the chocolate batter into the prepared baking pan. Pour the cheese mixture over the chocolate batter.  Top with the remaining chocolate batter from the reserved cupful. Use a spatula to make swirls across the top. Bake the brownies. Place in an oven at 350ºF/180ºC. Bake for about 35 to 40 minutes. Remove when baked. Allow to cool in the pan. Cut into brownie squares. Serve or store. Store in an airtight container, in the refrigerator. Peanut Butter Cheesecake Brownies Preheat the oven to 325ºF/170ºC. Spray (using non-stick oil) or line (with parchment paper) the baking pan. Add the chocolate chips and butter to a medium, heavy-based saucepan. Heat gently to melt. Remove from the heat and let cool.  Add the eggs, sugar and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl. Beat until fluffy and light. Add the melted chocolate mixture. Stir to combine. Add the flour and salt. Mix through. Pour the batter into the base of the baking pan.  Place the peanut butter, cream cheese and second lot of vanilla extract into a mixing bowl. Mix to combine. Add the sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time. Pour the cream in and add the flour. Mix to combine. Pour 1/3 cup of the topping into a separate bowl. Set aside. Pour the rest of the topping over the batter layer already in the pan.  Melt the remaining chocolate chips. Place them in the microwave and melt in 10-second bursts until melted, then stir until smooth. Alternatively, melt in a double boiler. Pour the melted chocolate into the reserved 1/3 cup of topping mixture. Drop in spoonfuls over the already added batter and topping, then swirl it with either a knife or a spatula. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownie comes out clean. Allow to cool in the pan. If wished, chill in the refrigerator to set slightly. Cut into brownie squares. Serve or store. If storing, keep in the refrigerator in a covered container.
